pullRequest.body:
The ring theoretic krull dimension is the order theoretic krull dimension applied to its prime spectrum. Unfolding this definition, it is the length of longest series of prime ideals ordered by inclusion.

---

@mariainesdff

- [x] depends on: #11147

By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

What happened with the idea of having a predicate `krullDimLT` that asserted that the krullDim of a given ring/space/... was LT a given natural number? Is there a discussion recorded somewhere with the pros and cons and the reason for going with a function valued in `WithTop (WithBot _)`?

> What happened with the idea of having a predicate `krullDimLT` that asserted that the krullDim of a given ring/space/... was LT a given natural number? Is there a discussion recorded somewhere with the pros and cons and the reason for going with a function valued in `WithTop (WithBot _)`?

No I have checked the streams on Zulip and I don't think there is any recorded discussion on that. The reason why we use `WithTop (WithBot _)` is that we eventually want `⊥ + ⊺ = ⊥`. It is true that for topological spaces `X` and `Y`, `dim(X × Y) = dim(X) + dim(Y)`. Now if `X` is empty and `Y` is infinite-dimensional, then `X × Y` is also empty. So we have `⊥ + ⊺ = dim(X) + dim(Y) = dim(X × Y) = ⊥`.

I think Johan is referring to @kbuzzard's idea that instead of defining `krullDim`, we can introduce a family of predicate `krullDimLT`, then the negative infinity case is `krullDimLT 0`, positive infinity case is `\forall n, \not krullDimLT n` and krull dimension equal to `n` is `krullDimLT (n +1)` and `\not krullDimLT n`

> Also please use `variable {R S : Type*} [CommRing R] [CommRing S]` at the top of the file.

Done!

> I think Johan is referring to @kbuzzard's idea that instead of defining `krullDim`, we can introduce a family of predicate `krullDimLT`, then the negative infinity case is `krullDimLT 0`, positive infinity case is `\forall n, \not krullDimLT n` and krull dimension equal to `n` is `krullDimLT (n +1)` and `\not krullDimLT n`

I have asked @kbuzzard recently and he said that both `WithBot (WithTop Nat)` and `krullDimLT` have advantages. We can define `krullDimLT` in another PR.

Thanks!

Thanks! I left some comments. Re "proof wanted": search mathlib for `proof_wanted` to see what the suggestion means. It's `proof_wanted <statement>`. It would be very easy to add the results for `Subsingleton`  (= ⊥) and 
`Nontrivial` (> ⊥) in this PR.
Also please use `variable {R S : Type*} [CommRing R] [CommRing S]` at the top of the file.
Based on the above comment, can I ask why you include this definition?

`krullDimOfRel` seems not to be a very useful definition. The only other relation I can think of that we want to consider Krull dimension of is `covby` for submodules. The length of a module can be defined as krull dimension of the poset submodules; the length of a composition series; the krull dimension of `covby` relation. But the last is conceptually the same as length of the composition series. So probably `krullDimOfRel` is not too useful a definition so I think we should remove it.
Thanks; then I agree that this could be deleted.
Do you really need `refine` here?
I have been warned that `refine'` should be replaced by `refine`.
Is `PrimeSpectrum.pointsEquivIrreducibleCloseds` relevant here?

This part of the module docstring should probably follow the conventions here https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/doc.html#header-comment , now there are so many key results. You should make a new `## Main statements` subheading and list the statements together with what the theorems are called in Lean. See e.g. `RingTheory/Ideal/IsPrincipal.lean` or many other mathlib files for the formatting you should use, ``* `theorem_name`: theorem_explanation``. Then it will display nicely in the online API docs.
I don't really see why this file is in the `Ideal` subdirectory, probably it should just be `RingTheory/KrullDimension.lean`.

I am a bit unclear about whether this is the right approach for naming. For example with `finprod` we just have loads of theorems whose names start with `finprod_` rather than a namespace `finprod`. I asked [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/namespace.20when.20no.20dot.20notation.20available/near/449635658).

I have noticed that [RingTheory/Multiplicity](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Multiplicity.html#multiplicity) uses the same naming method as mine. So I don't think I need to change the way I name theorems here.

I have formalized the following lemmas:
```
lemma mem_maximals_of_krullDim_eq_zero {α : Type*} [Preorder α] :
    krullDim α = 0 → ∀ (a : α), a ∈ maximals (fun x x1 ↦ x ≤ x1) ⊤ := ...

lemma mem_minimals_of_krullDim_eq_zero {α : Type*} [Preorder α] :
    krullDim α = 0 → ∀ (a : α), a ∈ minimals (fun x x1 ↦ x ≤ x1) ⊤ := ...

lemma krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_maximals_of_nonempty {α : Type*} [Preorder α] [Nonempty α] :
    krullDim α = 0 ↔ ∀ a : α, a ∈ maximals (· ≤ ·) ⊤ := ...

lemma krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_minimals_of_nonempty {α : Type*} [Preorder α] [Nonempty α] :
    krullDim α = 0 ↔ ∀ a : α, a ∈ minimals (· ≤ ·) ⊤ := ...
```
Then I made consequent changes to the proofs of the results
```
Ideal.IsPrime.isMaximal_of_ringKrullDim_eq_zero

Ideal.IsPrime.mem_minimalPrimes_of_ringKrullDim_eq_zero
```

Golf of these
```

lemma LTSeries.length_le_krullDim (p : LTSeries α) : p.length ≤ krullDim α := le_sSup ⟨_, rfl⟩ 

lemma mem_maximals_of_krullDim_eq_zero (h : krullDim α = 0) (a : α) :
    a ∈ maximals (· ≤ ·) Set.univ := by
  simp only [maximals, Set.mem_univ, true_implies, true_and]
  intro b hab
  by_contra hba
  let x : LTSeries α := ⟨1, ![a, b], (by simpa [Unique.forall_iff] using lt_of_le_not_le hab hba)⟩
  simpa using WithBot.one_le_coe.mp (x.length_le_krullDim.trans_eq h)

lemma krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_maximals_of_nonempty [Nonempty α] :
    krullDim α = 0 ↔ ∀ a : α, a ∈ maximals (· ≤ ·) Set.univ := by
  refine ⟨mem_maximals_of_krullDim_eq_zero, fun h ↦ ?_⟩
  simp only [maximals, Set.mem_univ, true_implies, true_and] at h
  have (p : LTSeries α) : p.length = 0 := by
    by_contra hp
    have : NeZero p.length := ⟨hp⟩
    exact lt_irrefl _ ((h (p 0) (p.step 0).le).trans_lt (p.step 0))
  simp only [krullDim, this, Nat.cast_zero, ciSup_const]

lemma mem_minimals_of_krullDim_eq_zero (h : krullDim α = 0) (a : α) :
    a ∈ minimals (· ≤ ·) ⊤ :=
  mem_maximals_of_krullDim_eq_zero (krullDim_orderDual.trans h) a
  
lemma krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_minimals_of_nonempty [Nonempty α] :
    krullDim α = 0 ↔ ∀ a : α, a ∈ minimals (· ≤ ·) ⊤ := by
  rw [← krullDim_orderDual, krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_maximals_of_nonempty]
  rfl
```
Thank you! Changed!

> I think the next lemma is good enough.

So shall I delete `PrimeSpectrum.asIdeal.mem_minimalPrimes_of_ringKrullDim_eq_zero`?
Can we make this an iff for domains?

I have formalised the theorem `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_isField_of_isDomain`, which says that the Krull dimension of an integral domain is zero if and only if it is a field. Could you please help me check if any golfing can be done? Also, shall I preserve the theorems `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_field` and `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_isField` or delete them?

`ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_field` should be kept. `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_isField` can be an `alias`. 
I was thinking along the lines of 
```
theorem PrimeSpectrum.mem_minimalPrimes_iff {p : PrimeSpectrum R} :
    p.asIdeal ∈ minimalPrimes R ↔ p ∈ minimals (· ≤ ·) Set.univ :=
  have : asIdeal '' Set.univ = {p : Ideal R | p.IsPrime ∧ ⊥ ≤ p} := by
    ext x; simpa using ⟨fun H ↦ H.choose_spec ▸ H.choose.2, fun H ↦ ⟨⟨_, H⟩, rfl⟩⟩
  Iff.trans (this ▸ Iff.rfl) (map_mem_minimals_iff (s := LE.le) (f := asIdeal) (by simp) (by simp))

theorem ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_forall_mem_minimalPrimes [Nontrivial R] :
  ringKrullDim R = 0 ↔ ∀ (I : Ideal R), I.IsPrime → I ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
  refine krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_minimals_of_nonempty.trans ?_
  simp_rw [← PrimeSpectrum.mem_minimalPrimes_iff]
  exact ⟨(· ⟨·, ·⟩), (· _ <| PrimeSpectrum.isPrime ·)⟩
  
attribute [local instance] Ideal.bot_prime

theorem ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_isField_of_isDomain [IsDomain R] :
    ringKrullDim R = 0 ↔ IsField R := by
  simp only [ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_forall_mem_minimalPrimes, minimalPrimes,
    Ideal.minimalPrimes_eq_subsingleton_self, Set.mem_singleton_iff,
    ← not_iff_comm.mp Ring.not_isField_iff_exists_prime, ne_eq, not_exists, not_and, not_imp_not]
```

The first lemma is also useful for `Ideal.IsPrime.mem_minimalPrimes_of_ringKrullDim_eq_zero` and the second should be added anyways (also the maximal version).

> `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_field` should be kept. `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_isField` can be an `alias`. I was thinking along the lines of
> 
> ```
> theorem PrimeSpectrum.mem_minimalPrimes_iff {p : PrimeSpectrum R} :
>     p.asIdeal ∈ minimalPrimes R ↔ p ∈ minimals (· ≤ ·) Set.univ :=
>   have : asIdeal '' Set.univ = {p : Ideal R | p.IsPrime ∧ ⊥ ≤ p} := by
>     ext x; simpa using ⟨fun H ↦ H.choose_spec ▸ H.choose.2, fun H ↦ ⟨⟨_, H⟩, rfl⟩⟩
>   Iff.trans (this ▸ Iff.rfl) (map_mem_minimals_iff (s := LE.le) (f := asIdeal) (by simp) (by simp))
> 
> theorem ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_forall_mem_minimalPrimes [Nontrivial R] :
>   ringKrullDim R = 0 ↔ ∀ (I : Ideal R), I.IsPrime → I ∈ minimalPrimes R := by
>   refine krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_minimals_of_nonempty.trans ?_
>   simp_rw [← PrimeSpectrum.mem_minimalPrimes_iff]
>   exact ⟨(· ⟨·, ·⟩), (· _ <| PrimeSpectrum.isPrime ·)⟩
>   
> attribute [local instance] Ideal.bot_prime
> 
> theorem ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_isField_of_isDomain [IsDomain R] :
>     ringKrullDim R = 0 ↔ IsField R := by
>   simp only [ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_forall_mem_minimalPrimes, minimalPrimes,
>     Ideal.minimalPrimes_eq_subsingleton_self, Set.mem_singleton_iff,
>     ← not_iff_comm.mp Ring.not_isField_iff_exists_prime, ne_eq, not_exists, not_and, not_imp_not]
> ```
> 
> The first lemma is also useful for `Ideal.IsPrime.mem_minimalPrimes_of_ringKrullDim_eq_zero` and the second should be added anyways (also the maximal version).

But the statement of `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_isField` is different from that of `ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_field`. One says that `isField` implies that the Krull dimension is 0; the other says that `Field` implies that the Krull dimension is 0. How can I make it an alias?
I was originally thinking of `alias ⟨_, ringKrullDim_eq_zero_of_isField⟩ := ringKrullDim_eq_zero_iff_isField_of_isDomain` but you're right let's keep both.

We would probably want iff versions of these or else there is little reason to let `ringKrullDim` be valued in `WithBot`. We are missing the analogous lemmas for `krullDim` though so maybe we can add this in a separate PR.
OK! I'll prove this in a new PR!

```suggestion
    a ∈ minimals (· ≤ ·) Set.univ :=
  mem_maximals_of_krullDim_eq_zero (krullDim_orderDual.trans h) a

lemma krullDim_eq_zero_iff_mem_minimals_of_nonempty [Nonempty α] :
    krullDim α = 0 ↔ ∀ a : α, a ∈ minimals (· ≤ ·) Set.univ := by
```

```suggestion
of its prime spectrum. Unfolding this definition, it is the length of the longest sequence of
prime ideals ordered by strict inclusion.
```

```suggestion
* `ringKrullDim`: The ring theoretic Krull dimension of a commutative ring.
```
same below.
This should import `Mathlib.RingTheory.PrimeSpectrum` and results that rely on Zariski topology should be moved to `AlgebraicGeometry`.
But in the current version of Mathlib of this pull request, there is no `Mathlib.RingTheory.PrimeSpectrum`. Do I need to run `git merge origin/master`?
It's good practice to merge master if it has been a week or more. Eg, GitHub can't tell if there is a linter failure in your PR because of new changes to master.
But after I ran `git merge origin/master`, there is still no `Mathlib.RingTheory.PrimeSpectrum`. How can I solve the problem?

After I changed the import into `Mathlib.RingTheory.PrimeSpectrum`, the core definition `ringKrullDim` stopped compiling because the instance `Preorder (PrimeSpectrum R)` could not be synthesized. And all the contents of the file rely on the definition `ringKrullDim`. I'm not sure how to resolve the problem now?

The current preorder on Spec R is given by the specialization order and depends on the topology. If it is easy to do you can redefine it using the induced order from ideals and move it to `RingTheory`. If not this could be done in a separate PR. But please still split the lemmas really depending on the topology into a new PR.
:/ Let's move this file to `AlgebraicGeometry.KrullDimension` and follow up with another PR moving back into `RingTheory` with the standard preorder and splitting off `Field` results.

So for this PR, shall I create a file `AlgebraicGeometry/KrullDimension.lean`, or shall I create a folder `AlgebraicGeometry/KrullDimension` and then a file `AlgebraicGeometry/KrullDimension/Basic.lean`?
Just a single file is ok for now since it will be touched again in another PR. We should get the correct preorder instance before splitting
Or we can wait for #15108.

> Or we can wait for #15108.

Yeah I feel that this is a good idea. Also I am not sure whether redefining `ringKrullDim` is a good idea because @jjaassoonn and I have already formalized a bunch of results (e.g. the Krull dimensions of PIDs, Artinian rings, etc.) based on the definition
```
noncomputable def ringKrullDim (R : Type*) [CommRing R] : WithBot (WithTop ℕ) :=
  krullDim (PrimeSpectrum R)
```
and I'm not sure if our proofs will remain as concise as before after redefining `ringKrullDim`.

I don't think `ringKrullDim` needs to change. We just need the preorder instance in scope for it to work. I didn't realize it was already the usual partial order (ideal containment) and can just be moved easily.

> Or we can wait for #15108.

This will be on master shortly

I have merged with master and changed the import into `Mathlib.RingTheory.PrimeSpectrum`, but `Preorder (PrimeSpectrum R)` still cannot be synthesized? Looks like I am not able to obtain the latest version of Mathlib 4?
I think you aren't fetching the most recent changes from the remote. Try `git fetch origin` before merging
I just merged master for you. Please try again.
(and yes next time please run `git fetch` before merging and merge with `origin master` and not the `master` branch on your local machine. Or `git pull origin master` works too I think.)

> I just merged master for you. Please try again.

Thank you!

The theorem “ringKrullDim_le_of_surjective” stopped compiling after I changed the import because the proof of the theorem uses “PrimeSpectrum.comap”. But I don’t think it is reasonable to move “ringKrullDim_le_of_surjective” to “AlgebraicGeometry”, because the theorem is one of the most basic theorems about the Krull dimension of a ring. Is there any good way to solve this problem?

Also, the proof of “ringKrullDim_le_of_surjective” does not need the continuity of “PrimeSpectrum.comap f”; it only needs the fact that “PrimeSpectrum.comap f” is injective when “f” is surjective.

The easy way out is to replace `comap` with its definition and the lemma with `Ideal.comap_injective_of_surjective` in the proof. The long term solution is to unbundle `comap` from continuity and move it to `RingTheory`
There should be a `PrimeSpectrum.comapFun`.
#15114 breaks out the function. It was done a bit hastily so please look it over.
@mattrobball Should #15114 be a dependency of this PR?
Assuming it looks fine yes. Otherwise, I would like to find a reasonable way to keep the line between commutative algebra and algebraic geometry at importing the Zariski topology.
Let's split this section into a separate file.

Shall I create a folder `Mathlib.RingTheory.KrullDimension` and create two files `Mathlib.RingTheory.KrullDimension.Basic` and `Mathlib.RingTheory.KrullDimension.Field` and then move the content of this section into `Mathlib.RingTheory.KrullDimension.Field`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Ideal/KrullDimension): define the Krull dimension of a ring

Note that the basic part of this PR is actually #11147

> Note that the basic part of this PR is actually #11147

Ah thanks, I didn't know about that one. I will list it as a dependency.

Repeating my comment on Zoom: I think it would be nice to add some examples, including Subsingleton (= ⊥), Nontrivial (> ⊥), Field (= 0), IsArtinianRing (≤ 0), Ring.DimensionLEOne (≤ 1), IsDomain + ¬ IsField (≥ 1), IsNoetherianRing (< ⊤).

And you might state [these](https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/4368191/bound-for-the-krull-dimension-of-a-polynomial-ring) [two](https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/1266827/krull-dimension-of-polynomial-rings-over-noetherian-rings) results about Polynomial as proof_wanted.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11147~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks! I left some comments. Re "proof wanted": search mathlib for `proof_wanted` to see what the suggestion means. It's `proof_wanted <statement>`. It would be very easy to add the results for `Subsingleton`  (= ⊥) and 
`Nontrivial` (> ⊥) in this PR.

What happened with the idea of having a predicate `krullDimLT` that asserted that the krullDim of a given ring/space/... was LT a given natural number? Is there a discussion recorded somewhere with the pros and cons and the reason for going with a function valued in `WithTop (WithBot _)`?

> What happened with the idea of having a predicate `krullDimLT` that asserted that the krullDim of a given ring/space/... was LT a given natural number? Is there a discussion recorded somewhere with the pros and cons and the reason for going with a function valued in `WithTop (WithBot _)`?

No I have checked the streams on Zulip and I don't think there is any recorded discussion on that. The reason why we use `WithTop (WithBot _)` is that we eventually want `⊥ + ⊺ = ⊥`. It is true that for topological spaces `X` and `Y`, `dim(X × Y) = dim(X) + dim(Y)`. Now if `X` is empty and `Y` is infinite-dimensional, then `X × Y` is also empty. So we have `⊥ + ⊺ = dim(X) + dim(Y) = dim(X × Y) = ⊥`.

I think Johan is referring to @kbuzzard's idea that instead of defining `krullDim`, we can introduce a family of predicate `krullDimLT`, then the negative infinity case is `krullDimLT 0`, positive infinity case is `\forall n, \not krullDimLT n` and krull dimension equal to `n` is `krullDimLT (n +1)` and `\not krullDimLT n`
Also please use `variable {R S : Type*} [CommRing R] [CommRing S]` at the top of the file.

> Also please use `variable {R S : Type*} [CommRing R] [CommRing S]` at the top of the file.

Done!

> I think Johan is referring to @kbuzzard's idea that instead of defining `krullDim`, we can introduce a family of predicate `krullDimLT`, then the negative infinity case is `krullDimLT 0`, positive infinity case is `\forall n, \not krullDimLT n` and krull dimension equal to `n` is `krullDimLT (n +1)` and `\not krullDimLT n`

I have asked @kbuzzard recently and he said that both `WithBot (WithTop Nat)` and `krullDimLT` have advantages. We can define `krullDimLT` in another PR.

Thanks!
